conclusion: Analyze velocity-time graphs to determine when objects are farthest apart.
Two velocity-time graphs labeled A and B; A has constant velocity, B decreases to zero.
Distance between objects is determined by their positions over time.
Object A's position increases linearly due to constant velocity.
Object B's position increases at a decreasing rate as velocity decreases.
Maximum distance occurs when object B stops moving and A continues.
Object B stops at time \( t_2 \), A continues moving.
Maximum distance occurs at time \( t_2 \).
